definitions.definition: a piece of cloth or similar material, typically oblong or square, attachable by one edge to a pole or rope and used as the symbol or emblem of a country or institution or as a decoration during public festivities.
synonyms: Union Jack; Jolly Roger; Red Ensign

definitions.definition: used in reference to the country to which a person has allegiance.
examples: the private's heroism served as an example for every soldier under the flag

definitions.definition: a ship's country of registry.
a small piece of cloth, typically attached at one edge to a pole, used as a marker or signal in various sports.
examples: jumped the starter's flag, did he?

definitions.definition: the ensign carried by a flagship as an emblem of an admiral's rank.
a device, symbol, or drawing typically resembling a flag, used as a marker.
examples: golf courses are indicated by a numbered flag on the map

definitions.definition: a variable used to indicate a particular property of the data in a record.
a hook attached to the stem of a musical note, determining the rhythmic value of the note.
mark (an item) for attention or treatment in a specified way.
examples: “greatfully” would be flagged as a misspelling of “gratefully.”

definitions.definition: draw attention to.
examples: problems often flag the need for organizational change

definitions.definition: charge (a player) with a penalty by dropping a penalty flag.
examples: a play in which he was flagged for being offside

definitions.definition: direct (someone) to go in the specified direction by waving a flag or using hand signals.
examples: have him flagged off the course

definitions.definition: signal to a vehicle or driver to stop, especially by waving one's arm.
examples: she flagged down a patrol car

definitions.definition: (of an official in football, soccer, and other sports) raise or throw a flag to indicate a breach of the rules.
examples: the rookie cornerback managed to get flagged for three penalties in one game

definitions.definition: provide or decorate with a flag or flags.
register (a vessel) in a specific country, under whose flag it then sails.
examples: the flagging out of much of the fleet to flags of convenience

definitions.definition: a flat stone slab, typically rectangular or square, used for paving.
a plant with sword-shaped leaves that grow from a rhizome.
the long slender leaf of a flag plant.
(of a person) become tired, weaker, or less enthusiastic.
examples: if you begin to flag, there is an excellent café to revive you
synonyms: run out of steam More"they were flagging toward the finish"fade
die away/down "my energy flags in the afternoon"

definitions.definition: (especially of an activity or quality) become weaker or less dynamic.
examples: she should make another similar film to revive her flagging career
